sentences.sContent: a book of old Japanese folk tales
a fairy tale by Hans Christian Andersen
tales of her life in post-war Berlin
sentences.sCn: 有关她在战后柏林生活的传闻

sentences.sContent: ...We are suffering, he writes, from a "serendipity deficit." The word "serendipity" was coined by Horace Walpole in an 1854 letter from a tale of three princes whowere always making discoveries by accident...
...Nearly every business has a sad tale to tell...

synos.tran: 故事；传说；叙述；流言蜚语

phrases.pCn: n. 吹牛，说大话；夸张的故事，荒诞的故事
无稽之谈；愚蠢的迷信（尤指老妇人所持的）

words.tran: 讲故事的人；搬弄是非者；揭人隐私者（等于talebearer）

trans.tranOther: a story about exciting imaginary events
